title.native: シュガーアップル・フェアリーテイル

description:
In a world where fairies are bought and sold to the highest bidder, humans aren’t exactly on friendly terms with the fae folk. But friendship is exactly what Anne Halford seeks with Challe, her new fairy bodyguard, though he’s not so keen on the idea. As his new master, Anne tasks him with escorting her through a particularly dangerous area, but with a reluctant bodyguard eager to escape a life of servitude, she’ll have to deal with a lot more than she bargained for...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
__Tools:__ IllustStudio, Cintiq 13HD

[Twitter](http://twitter.com/moyasshi) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/1101)

Her older sister introduced her to manga by showing Aki the comics she drew and later buying her a Saint Seiya doujinshi. She became a mangaka mainly because of her father's and sister's influences, both of whom she said are fans of anime and manga. She grew up surrounded by anime such as Doraemon, which is largely due to her father's interest in anime.

After being introduced to the Saint Seiya doujinshi, she became interested in doujinshi of other series, such as Gundam Wing. In 2000, she started up her own doujinshi circle, Shachou no Subako (a Gensou Suikoden centered circle (though, it recently began releasing doujinshi for other series as well, such as Tales of Zestiria and Road to Dragons). Later, in 2006, she published her first series, Utahime, in Libre Shuppan's Kurofune Zero.

In addition to being a mangaka, Aki also illustrates light novels.

(Source: Aki's long interview in Haruca)

She owns a dog which she affectionately calls "furball."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).
Tsubakiyama Hinako is a composer, arranger and lyricist.

__Agency:__ Gekidan Himawari

[Profile](https://profile.himawari.net/view/1622) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/smileysuu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sumire__morohoshi/) | [YouTube](https://youtube.com/channel/UCTlieWyDS62ZGG3yMFswS5g) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumire_Morohoshi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%AB%B8%E6%98%9F%E3%81%99%E3%81%BF%E3%82%8C)

Sumire Morohoshi is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer from Kanagawa Prefecture. She is affiliated with Himawari Theatre Group, and debuted as a solo singer under the record label Flying Dog.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Pela - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yuni - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Product 08 - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Gallica - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Yaiyai Yarucar - Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger (TV Series)

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where she is one of the sub-leaders.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Website](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/suzuki-minori.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minoringo_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7f1T-CF50uNMmGK_I9cILQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Ath9xfI4WBdrZPFQ4VX9A?si=RqHEeCs9Sci2RtrWnmqvfQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minoringo_official/)

She got picked out of 8000 people for the role of [Freyja Wion](https://anilist.co/character/90101/Freyja-Wion). She had no prior voice acting work.

Minori Suzuki is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

More recently she has also been involved in storyboarding and episode directing.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where she is one of the sub-leaders.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where she is one of the sub-leaders.
